responsibilities: I currently manage release pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of code from different teams. I troubleshoot pipeline issues using my debugging skills and automate repetitive tasks to prevent failures and reduce manual effort.

I served as the Subject Matter Expert and Single Point of Contact for Automation. My role involved developing processes and scripts to automate repetitive manual tasks, reports, and alerts. I played a key role in guiding individuals with diverse skill sets to successfully complete projects. Additionally, I analyzed the incident database to identify recurring failures, investigated root causes, and resolved issues with support from relevant teams.

Worked on a web application that tracks a vendor's human resources (or consultants). The primary feature of the web application was to shortlist the consultants as per client requirements and skillsets possessed by the consultants.
Technical Specifications of the application: Front End ASP.net with VB.net scripting and Backend hosted on MS SQL Server.

project_description: In this project, my teammate and I developed an Android application that will generate crop recommendations at the click of a button based on Indian soil conditions. The application is cost-efficient and runs on minimal data input from the user. It gives significantly less response time, with no heavy database and hardware requirement.

project_title: Secondary Memory-Based Implementation of Shortest Path Algorithm
project_description: In this project, the disk blocks in a secondary memory have been depicted as text files, with node and edge details stored in these files. Every file will hold limited tuples (node/edge details). Consecutive blocks are linked to each other using links in the file. I efficiently implemented Dijkstra’s algorithm to find the shortest path between the source and destination nodes. We tested the solution on a graph with 50000 nodes, thus can be scaled.
